caption.title: Summary of TTX-producing bacteria isolated from rough-skinned newts.
caption.p: Genus-level identification of each TTX-producing isolate was determined by 16S rRNA gene sequencing and taxonomic classification by the Ribosomal Database Project classifier tool at 80% similarity cut-off (Cole et al., 2014). TTX production was determined by screening 1 mL culture media using LC-MS/MS. Overall, we cultured 11 TTX-producing isolates, though 16S gene sequence alignments suggest that some isolates may represent the same bacterial strain (see text). In most cases, TTX was detected in replicate cultures above the limit of detection (LOD), but not always above the lower limit of quantification (LLOQ). Mean TTX production ± standard error (SEM) is shown for samples above the LLOQ. Some of these bacterial genera contain TTX-producing strains that have previously been identified in other toxic animals (reviewed in Chau et al., 2011).
